data.name: Energy Retrieval
rules: Trade 1 of the other cards in your hand for up to 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile.

data.name: Tool Retriever
rules: Choose up to 2 Pokémon Tool cards attached to your Pokémon and put them into your hand.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Teddiursa

attacks.name: Rest
attacks.text: Remove all Special Conditions and 2 damage counters from Teddiursa. Teddiursa is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Sweet Palm
attacks.text: Before doing damage, remove 1 damage counter from the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It lets honey soak into its paws so it can lick them all the time. Every sets of paws tastes unique.

data.name: Night Maintenance
rules: Search your discard pile for up to 3 in any combination of Pokémon and basic Energy cards. Show them to your opponent and shuffle them into your deck.

data.name: Max Elixir
rules: Look at the top 6 cards of your deck and attach a basic Energy card you find there to a Basic Pokémon on your Bench. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Exploud

attacks.name: Destructive Sound
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand. Discard all Item cards you find there.

attacks.name: Round
attacks.text: Does 50 damage times the number of your Pokémon that have the Round attack.

data.flavorText: Its howls can be heard over six miles away. It emits all sorts of noises from the ports on its body.

data.name: Crabominable

attacks.name: Fight Alone
attacks.text: If you have fewer Pokémon in play than your opponent, this attack does 50 more damage for each Pokémon fewer you have in play.

data.flavorText: It stores coldness in its pincers and pummels its foes. It can even smash thick walls of ice to bits!

data.name: Tyranitar ex δ
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Electromark
attacks.text: Put a Shock-wave marker on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hyper Claws
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Stage 2 Evolved Pokémon, this attack does 70 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Shock-wave
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that has any Shock-wave markers on it. That Pokémon is Knocked Out.

data.name: Pineco

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Pineco does 50 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It looks just like a pinecone. Its shell protects it from bird Pokémon that peck it by mistake.

data.name: Surfing Pikachu
data.flavorText: One summer, a group of Pikachu was found riding the waves at the local beach.

data.name: Gyarados

attacks.name: Thrash
attacks.text: If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage. If tails, Gyarados does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: They say that during past strife, Gyarados would appear and leave blazing ruins in its wake.

data.name: Misty's Determination
rules: Discard a card from your hand. If you do, look at the top 8 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Heracross

attacks.name: Turn the Tables
attacks.text: If 1 of your opponent's Pokémon used a GX attack during their last turn, your opponent shuffles their Active Pokémon and all cards attached to it into their deck.

data.flavorText: It's proud of its thick horn. In Alola, its biggest rival is Vikavolt, which it's always fighting with.

attacks.name: Super Psywave
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Count the amount of Energy attached to that Pokémon. Put that many damage counters on the Pokémon.

data.name: Bouffalant

abilities.name: Bouffer
abilities.text: Any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Gold Breaker
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Pokémon-EX, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.flavorText: They charge wildly and headbutt everything. Their headbutts have enough destructive force to derail a trail.

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Kricketot
data.flavorText: Its legs are short. Whenever it stumbles, its stiff antennae clack with a xylophone-like sound.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy card attached to Cyndaquil.

data.name: Koffing
data.flavorText: Its body is full of poisonous gas. It floats into garbage dumps, seeking out the fumes of raw, rotting trash.

data.name: Bouffalant

attacks.name: Bouffant Head
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Knock Over
attacks.text: You may discard any Stadium card in play.

data.flavorText: They charge wildly and headbutt everything. Their headbutts have enough destructive force to derail a train.

data.name: Krokorok

attacks.name: Dredge Up
attacks.text: Discard the top 3 cards of your opponent's deck.

data.flavorText: It buries some of its prey in the sand to use as emergency meals when its hunts are unsuccessful.

data.name: Serperior

abilities.name: Royal Garden
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Grass Energy attached to it, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

data.flavorText: It only gives its all against strong opponents who are not fazed by the glare from Serperior's noble eyes.

data.name: Pokédex
rules: Look at up to 5 cards from the top of your deck and rearrange them as you like.

data.name: Krookodile

attacks.name: Dredge Up
attacks.text: Discard the top 3 cards of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Tantrum
attacks.text: This Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: It conceals itself in sandstorms that Flygon whip up and waits patiently for prey to appear.

data.name: Metagross ★
rules: You can't have more than 1 Pokémon Star in your deck.

attacks.name: Critical Collection
attacks.text: Count the number of Prize cards your opponent has taken. Search your discard pile for up to that many Metal Energy cards and attach them to Metagross Star.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Galarian Weezing

abilities.name: Neutralizing Gas
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, your opponent's Pokémon in play have no Abilities, except for Neutralizing Gas.

attacks.name: Severe Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 4 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon during Pokémon Checkup.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon consumes particles that contaminate the air. Instead of leaving droppings, it expels clean air.

data.name: Ash's Pikachu

attacks.name: Iron Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: This form of Pikachu is somewhat rare. It wears the hat of its Trainer, who is also its partner.

data.name: Tornadus-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Windfall
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 6 cards.

attacks.name: Jet Blast
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Plasma Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Recycle Energy
rules: Recycle Energy provides Colorless Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)
If this card is put into your discard pile from play, return it to your hand.

data.name: Dratini

abilities.name: Defensive Scales
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, except damage, done to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It's still weak, so it lurks on the floor of bodies of water, eating whatever food sinks down and living a quiet life.

data.name: Noibat

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: They live in pitch black caves. Their enormous ears can emit ultrasonic waves of 200,000 hertz.

data.name: Groudon

attacks.name: Drought
attacks.text: Attach up to 2 Fighting Energy cards from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Trembling Ground
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Trembling Ground during your next turn.

data.flavorText: Said to have expanded the lands by evaporating water with raging heat. It battled titanically with Kyogre.

data.name: Volcanion-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Steam Up
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Fire Energy card from your hand. If you do, during this turn, your Basic Fire Pokémon's attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Volcanic Heat
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

abilities.name: Fan Shift
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. Fan Rotom's type is Colorless until the end of your turn.

attacks.name: Spin Storm
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent returns the Defending Pokémon and all cards attached to it to his or her hand.

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard an Energy attached to Fan Rotom.

data.name: Target Whistle Team Flare Gear
rules: Put a Basic Pokémon from your opponent's discard pile onto his or her Bench.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Darkrai

abilities.name: Darkness Guard
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Darkness Energy attached, it takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Vortex of Darkness
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Darkness Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during nights of the new moon.

data.name: Beast Ring
rules: You can play this card only if your opponent has exactly 3 or 4 Prize cards remaining.
Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Ultra Beasts. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Energy Flow
rules: For each of your Pokémon, you may return any number of Energy cards attached to it to your hand.

attacks.name: Fastball
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Charge Beam
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to Voltorb.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Master Ball
rules: Look at 7 cards from the top of your deck. You may choose a Basic Pokémon or Evolution card from those cards, show it to your opponent, then put it into your hand. Shuffle the rest into your deck.

data.name: Fan Rotom

abilities.name: Roto Motor
abilities.text: If you have 9 or more Pokémon Tool cards in your discard pile, ignore all Energy in the attack cost of each of this Pokémon's attacks.

attacks.name: Spinning Fan
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.

data.name: Swablu

attacks.name: Bind Wound
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Wings and beaks. I like yours, and I like mine, too.

data.name: Max Potion
rules: Heal all damage from 1 of your Pokémon. If you do, discard all Energy attached to that Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Power Memory
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
The Zygarde-EX this card is attached to can also use the attack on this card. (You still need the necessary Energy to use this attack.)
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.name: All Cells Burn
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: ナッシー[Exeggutor]

attacks.name: ふみつけ[Stomp]
attacks.text: コインを1回投げオモテなら、10ダメージを追加。 Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.flavorText: Dr.オーヤマ考案「日米交流カード」パーティ気分で和洋せっちゅう。

data.name: Winona
rules: Search your deck for up to 3 Colorless Pokémon and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Professor Rowan
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Choose 1 card in your hand and shuffle the rest of your cards into your deck. Then, draw 4 cards. (If this is the only card in your hand, you can't play this card.)

data.name: Shining Raichu
rules: You can't have more than 1 Shining Raichu in your deck.

attacks.name: Thundersquall
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon for each Water Energy attached to Shining Raichu. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: If the electricity in its cheeks runs out, it sticks its tail straight up and uses it to collect energy from the air.

data.name: Evosoda
rules: Search your deck for a card that evolves from 1 of your Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use this card during your first turn or on a Pokémon that was put into play this turn.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Gyarados-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Draconic Disaster
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 100 more damage. Then, discard that Stadium card.

attacks.name: Dread Storm-GX
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from each of your opponent's Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Poké Ball
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Raikou ★
rules: You can't have more than 1 Pokémon Star in your deck.

attacks.name: Lightning Turn
attacks.text: Switch Raikou Star with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Meta Voltage
attacks.text: If you have less Prize cards left than your opponent, this attack does 40 damage to each of your Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Patrat

attacks.name: Patrol
attacks.text: Look at the top 3 cards of your deck and put them back on top of your deck in any order.

data.flavorText: Extremely cautious, one of them will always be on the lookout, but it won't notice a foe coming from behind.

data.name: Lugia-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Overflow
abilities.text: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an attack of this Pokémon, take 1 more Prize card.

attacks.name: Plasma Gale
attacks.text: Discard a Plasma Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you can't discard a Plasma Energy, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Kyogre-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Smash Turn
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dual Splash
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Totodile

attacks.name: Shining Fang
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

data.flavorText: It has the habit of biting anything with its developed jaws. Even its Trainer need to be careful.

data.name: Charizard ★ δ
rules: You can't have more than 1 Pokémon Star in your deck.

attacks.name: Rotating Claws
attacks.text: You may discard an Energy card attached to Charizard Star. If you do, search your discard pile for an Energy card (excluding the one you discarded) and attach it to Charizard Star.

attacks.name: Dark Swirl
attacks.text: Discard all Energy cards attached to Charizard Star and discard the top 3 cards from your opponent's deck.

data.name: Venusaur ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Energy Trans
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), move a Grass Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Venusaur ex is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Pollen Hazard
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned, Burned, and Confused.

data.name: Breloom

attacks.name: Spore
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Pre-Dawn Strike
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Asleep, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.flavorText: Its short arms stretch when it throws punches. Its technique is equal to that of pro boxers.

attacks.name: Evil Eye
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Put a damage counter on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Blindside
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that has a damage counter on it. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

data.name: Sudowoodo

attacks.name: Reply Strongly
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn while it was your Active Pokémon, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.flavorText: Apparently, the larger the green parts of this Pokémon, the more collectors value it. It's a particular favorite among elderly people.

data.name: Alph Lithograph
rules: Look at your opponent's hand!

data.name: Stakataka

abilities.name: Wall of Stone
abilities.text: If your opponent has 3 or fewer Prize cards remaining, this Pokémon's maximum HP is 200.

attacks.name: Top Down
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

data.flavorText: It appeared from an Ultra Wormhole. Each one appears to be made up of many life-forms stacked one on top of each other.

data.name: Bill
rules: Draw 2 cards.

data.name: Training Center
rules: Each Stage 1 and Stage 2 Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) gets +30 HP.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Magikarp

attacks.name: Flail Around
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: A Magikarp living for many years can leap a mountain using Splash. The move remains useless, though.

data.name: Grapploct

attacks.name: Octolock
attacks.text: Until this Grapploct leaves the Active Spot, the Defending Pokémon's attacks cost ColorlessColorless more, and the Defending Pokémon can't retreat. This effect can't be applied more than once.

attacks.name: Tough Swing
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.flavorText: A body made up of nothing but muscle makes the grappling moves this Pokémon performs with its tentacles tremendously powerful.

data.name: Wingull
data.flavorText: Fishermen keep an eye out for Wingull in the sky, because wherever they're circling, the ocean is sure to be teeming with fish Pokémon.

data.name: Here Comes Team Rocket!
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Each player plays with his or her Prize cards face up for the rest of the game.

data.name: Stufful
data.flavorText: Despite its adorable appearance, when it gets angry and flails about, its arms and legs could knock a pro wrestler sprawling.

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

data.name: Gumshoos-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Search the Premises
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may have your opponent reveal their hand.

attacks.name: Gumshoe Chance-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Zekrom

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Bolt Strike
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 40 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon appears in legends. In its tail, it has a giant generator that creates electricity.

data.name: Bunnelby

ancientTrait.name: Ω Barrage
ancientTrait.text: This Pokémon may attack twice a turn. (If the first attack Knocks Out your opponent's Active Pokémon, you may attack again after your opponent chooses a new Active Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Burrow
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Rototiller
attacks.text: Shuffle a card from your discard pile into your deck.

data.flavorText: It has ears like shovels. Digging holes strengthens its ears so much that they can sever thick roots effortlessly.

data.name: Axew

attacks.name: Extra Chop
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: They mark their territory by leaving gashes in trees with their tusks. If a tusk breaks, a new one grows in quickly.

data.name: Mewtwo-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Shatter Shot
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage times the amount of Psychic Energy attached to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Damage Change
attacks.text: Switch all damage counters on this Pokémon with those on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Poliwag

attacks.name: Twiddle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: Its skin is so thin, its internal organs are visible. It has trouble walking on its newly grown feet.

data.name: Dialga LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Dialga. Dialga LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Time Skip
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may have your opponent flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, your turn ends. If both of them are tails, after your opponent draws a card at the beginning of his or her next turn, his or her turn ends. This power can't be used if Dialga is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Metal Flash
attacks.text: During your next turn, Dialga can't use Metal Flash.

data.name: Rufflet

attacks.name: Chirp
attacks.text: Search your deck for 2 Pokémon with Fighting Resistance, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Sharp Beak
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: They crush berries with their talons. They bravely stand up to any opponent, no matter how strong it is.

data.name: PlusPower
rules: Attach PlusPower to 1 of your Pokémon. Discard this card at the end of your turn.
If the Pokémon PlusPower is attached to attacks, the attack does 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Growlithe

attacks.name: Rest
attacks.text: Heal all damage from this Pokémon. This Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: Extremely loyal to its Trainer, it will bark at those who approach the Trainer unexpectedly and run them out of town.

attacks.name: Fury Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Dragonair

attacks.name: Twister
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon. If both of them are tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: Lakes where Dragonair live are filled with offerings from people, because they believe this Pokémon is able to control the weather.

data.name: Misty's Determination
rules: Discard a card from your hand. If you do, look at the top 8 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Ash's Pikachu

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Volt Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: This form of Pikachu is somewhat rare. It wears the hat of its Trainer, who is also its partner.

data.name: Poliwhirl

attacks.name: Bubblebeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: The spiral pattern on its belly subtly undulates. Staring at it gradually causes drowsiness.

data.name: Vulpix

attacks.name: Fire Soul
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It controls balls of fire. As it grows, its six tails split from their tips to make more tails.

data.name: Altaria

attacks.name: Fairy Friend
attacks.text: If you have any Fairy Pokémon on your Bench, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: This fluffiness makes everyone go crazy. Is it really that charming?

data.name: Acro Bike
rules: Look at the top 2 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. Discard the other card.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Magnemite

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: The faster the units at its sides rotate, the greater the magnetic force they generate.

data.name: Rival
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Reveal the top 5 cards of your deck. Your opponent chooses 3 of those cards. Put those cards into your hand and put other 2 cards on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Misty's Duel
rules: You and your opponent play a game of Rock-Paper-Scissors. The winner shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck and draws a new hand of 5 cards. (If you don't know how to play Rock-Paper-Scissors, flip a coin to decide who's the winner.)

data.name: Professor Oak's Visit
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Draw 3 cards. Then, choose a card from your hand and put it on the bottom of your deck.

data.name: Drilbur

attacks.name: Rototiller
attacks.text: Shuffle a card from your discard pile into your deck.

data.flavorText: It makes its way swiftly through the soil by putting both claws together and rotating at high speed.

data.name: Palkia LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Palkia. Palkia LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Restructure
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may have your opponent switch 1 of your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. Then, you switch 1 of the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This power can't be used if Palkia is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Hydro Reflect
attacks.text: You may move all Energy cards attached to Palkia to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like. (Ignore this effect if you don't have any Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Stunky

data.name: Mysterious Fossil
rules: Play Mysterious Fossil as if it were a Basic Pokémon. While in play, Mysterious Fossil counts as a Pokémon (instead of a Trainer card). Mysterious Fossil has no attacks, can't retreat, and can't be affected by Special Conditions. If Mysterious Fossil is Knocked Out, it doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon. (Discard it anyway.) At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Mysterious Fossil from play. You can put Pokémon that evolve from Mysterious Fossil on this card.

attacks.name: Superpower
attacks.text: You may do 40 more damage. If you do, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: This immensely dangerous Pokémon possesses overwhelming physical strength. Its habitat is generally off-limits.

data.name: Heracross-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Giga Power
attacks.text: You may do 40 more damage. If you do, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.name: Moltres ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Legendary Ascent
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Moltres ex from your hand onto your Bench, you may switch 1 of your Active Pokémon with Moltres ex. If you do, you may also move any number of basic Fire Energy cards attached to your Pokémon to Moltres ex.

attacks.name: Crushing Flames
attacks.text: You may discard an Energy card attached to Moltres ex. If you do, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Surfing Pikachu
data.flavorText: One summer, a group of Pikachu was found riding the waves at the local beach.

data.name: Patrat

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Extremely cautious, one of them will always be on the lookout, but it won't notice a foe coming from behind.

data.name: Potion
rules: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Floral Crown
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
At the end of your opponent's turn, heal 20 damage from the Basic Pokémon this card is attached to.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Galarian Meowth

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: Living with a savage, seafaring people has toughened this Pokémon's body so much that parts of it have turned to iron.

data.name: Liepard

abilities.name: Limber
abilities.text: This Pokémon can't be Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Don't be fooled by its gorgeous fur and elegant figure. This is a moody and vicious Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mountain Eater
attacks.text: Your opponent discards the top card from his or her deck. Then you remove a damage counter from Larvitar.

attacks.name: Rising Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

data.name: Rival
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Reveal the top 5 cards of your deck. Your opponent chooses 3 of those cards. Put those cards into your hand and put other 2 cards on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Devolution Spray
rules: Devolve 1 of your evolved Pokémon and put the highest stage Evolution card on it into your hand. (That Pokémon can't evolve this turn.)
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Slakoth

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Slack Off
attacks.text: Heal all damage from this Pokémon. It can't attack during your next turn.

data.flavorText: If it eats just three leaves in a day, it is satisfied. Other than that, it sleeps for 20 hours a day.

data.name: Honchkrow-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Ruler of the Night
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent can't play any Pokémon Tool, Special Energy, or Stadium cards from their hand.

attacks.name: Feather Storm
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Unfair-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. Discard 2 cards from it. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: VS Seeker
rules: Put a Supporter card from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Medicham

attacks.name: Pure Power
attacks.text: Put 4 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Master Strike
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has a Karate Belt card attached to it, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.flavorText: It elegantly avoids attacks with dance-like steps, then launches a devastating blow in the same motion.

data.name: Hitmontop

attacks.name: Rapid Spin
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Triple Kick
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: If you are enchanted by its smooth, dance-like kicks, you may get a closer experience with one than you'd like.

data.name: Bebe's Search
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.

Choose a card from your hand and put it on top of your deck. Search your deck for a Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. (If this is the only card in your hand, you can't play this card.)

data.name: Piplup

attacks.name: Charm
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: A poor walker, it often falls down. However, its strong pride makes it puff up its chest without a care.

data.name: Sigilyph

abilities.name: Safeguard
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by Pokémon-EX.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: This extremely rare Pokémon is a different color than usual. It is very hard to find.

data.name: Lillipup

attacks.name: Roar
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Though it is a very brave Pokémon, it's also smart enough to check its foe's strength and avoid battle.

data.name: Deino
data.flavorText: When it encounters something, its first urge is usually to bite it. If it likes what it tastes, it will commit the associated scent to memory.

data.name: Nihilego-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Empty Light
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may leave both Active Pokémon Confused and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Lock Up
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Symbiont-GX
attacks.text: Add the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck to their Prize cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

attacks.name: Bad Dream
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Trubbish

attacks.name: Venoshock
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 50 more damage.

data.flavorText: Its favorite places are unsanitary ones. If you leave trash lying around, you could even find one of these Pokémon living in your room.

data.name: Ash's Pikachu

attacks.name: Iron Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: This form of Pikachu is somewhat rare. It wears the hat of its Trainer, who is also its partner.

data.name: Great Ball
rules: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal a Pokémon you find there and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Pidgey

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.flavorText: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.

attacks.name: Long Tongue
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon in play. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Bill
rules: Draw 2 cards.

data.name: Roseanne's Research
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Search your deck for up to 2 in any combination of Basic Pokémon and basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Zapdos ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Legendary Ascent
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Zapdos ex from your hand onto your Bench, you may switch 1 of your Active Pokémon with Zapdos ex. If you do, you may also move any number of basic Lightning Energy cards attached to your Pokémon to Zapdos ex.

attacks.name: Electron Crush
attacks.text: You may discard an Energy card attached to Zapdos ex. If you do, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Giant Cape
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
The Pokémon this card is attached to gets +20 HP.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Professor Sycamore
rules: Discard your hand and draw 7 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Scorched Earth
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may discard a Fire or Fighting Energy card from his or her hand. If that player does so, he or she draws 2 cards.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Oranguru

attacks.name: Resource Management
attacks.text: Put 3 cards from your discard pile on the bottom of your deck in any order.

attacks.name: Profound Knowledge
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: Deep in the jungle, high in the lofty canopy, this Pokémon abides. On rare occasions, it shows up at the beach to match wits with Slowking.

data.name: Mew

attacks.name: Clairvoyance
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its DNA is said to contain the genetic codes of all Pokémon, so it can use all kinds of techniques.

data.name: Aether Paradise Conservation Area
rules: Basic Grass and Basic Lightning Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) take 30 less damage from the opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

abilities.name: Wash Shift
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. Wash Rotom's type is Water until the end of your turn.

attacks.name: Cleanse Away
attacks.text: Remove 3 damage counters from each of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Drain Wash
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it.

data.name: Shinx

attacks.name: Recharge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card attach it to Shinx. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.

data.name: Imakuni?'s Doduo
rules: (This card cannot be used at official tournaments.)

abilities.name: Frenzied Escape
abilities.text: When this Doduo retreats, hold this card and throw it as hard as you can because Doduo is running away. Throw the card horizontally with a snap to get the farthest distance!

attacks.name: Harmonize
attacks.text: From the moment you use this attack, you must begin to sing a song. (While the song is being sung, the game continues.) When the song is finished, this attack does 30 damage.

data.name: Team Galactic's Invention G-101 Energy Gain
rules: Attach Team Galactic's Invention G-101 Energy Gain to 1 of your Pokémon SP that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If that Pokémon is Knocked Out, discard this card. When the Pokémon this card is attached to is no longer a Pokémon SP, discard this card.
As long as Team Galactic's Invention G-101 Energy Gain is attached to a Pokémon, the attack cost of that Pokémon's attacks is Colorless less.

data.name: Celebi ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Spiral Leaf
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon. If tails, remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Time Trap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, look at the top 4 cards of your opponent's deck, and put them back on top of your opponent's deck in any order. If tails, look at the top 4 cards of your deck, and put them back on top of your deck in any order.

data.name: Acerola
rules: Put 1 of your Pokémon that has any damage counters on it and all cards attached to it into your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Warp Point
rules: Your opponent switches 1 of his or her Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any. You switch 1 of your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon, if any.

data.name: Dive Ball
rules: Search your deck for a Water Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Eneporter
rules: Move a Special Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon to another of their Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Rocket's Secret Experiment
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for any card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. If tails, you can't play Trainer cards until the end of your next turn.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon card named Nidoran ♀ or Nidoran ♂ and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)

data.name: Tornadus-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Blow Through
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Power Blast
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Stonjourner VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Stone Gift
attacks.text: Attach a Fighting Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon. If you do, heal 120 damage from that Pokémon.

data.name: Wally
rules: Search your deck for a card that evolves from 1 of your Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-EX) and put it onto that Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward. You can use this card during your first turn or on a Pokémon that was put into play this turn.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Haxorus

attacks.name: Dragon Dance
attacks.text: As long as this Haxorus is your Active Pokémon, each of its attacks does 100 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance). You can't add more than 100 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Dragon Pulse
attacks.text: Discard the top 3 cards of your deck.

data.flavorText: Their sturdy tusks will stay sharp even if used to cut steel beams. These Pokémon are covered in hard armor.

data.name: Patrat

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Extremely cautious, there is always one keeping watch, but they don't notice enemies coming from behind.

data.name: Galarian Perrserker

attacks.name: Stealy Claws
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. If any of them are heads, your opponent reveals their hand. Then, for each heads, discard a Trainer card from your opponent's hand.

data.flavorText: What appears to be an iron helmet is actually hardened hair. This Pokémon lives for the thrill of battle.

data.name: Carvanha
data.flavorText: They're such cowards that they won't hunt alone. When five or so of them get together, they suddenly turn ferocious!

data.name: VS Seeker
rules: Put a Supporter card from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).
